fields_of_interest: Culture and media, Consumers, Culture, Education and training, Business and Industry, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Research and innovation, Trans-European Networks, Digital economy and society, Communication
inter_groups:
Engaging directly with Members of European Parliament through meetings. Encouraging our community members to also engage MEPs though various means, including an email tool and social media outreach.  
 
Delivering the voices of concerned Internet users to this body through social media and online engagement.
eu_initiatives:
European Commission's Digital Single Market Strategy  
 
Public engagement on copyright legislaton and drafting of updates to copyright policies  
 
Regulatory environment for platforms, online intermediaries, data and cloud computing and the collaborative economy 
 
Updates to the Copyright Directive  
 
InfoSoc Directive
subsection: Non-governmental organisations, platforms and networks and similar
membership: Legal members of OpenMedia only include staff and board, however we serve a community of over 700,000 globally, including Internet users in all of the countries mentioned above and many others as well.

goals__remit:
OpenMedia is a digital policy organization that works to keep the Internet open, affordable, and surveillance-free. We create community-driven campaigns to engage, educate, and empower people to safeguard the Internet. At OpenMedia, we work to make it simple for users to learn about issues that will affect how they use the Internet and amplify their voices on key digital policy issues.  
 
We engage Internet users in mass collaborative campaigns using social media and innovative online tools. 
 
We educate the Internet community about key issues of the day. 
 
We empower people by opening government processes to public input and scrutiny, and by crowdsourcing positive policy plans.
